title: (x) Grace - "closed" Delphian Open {Mike Y}
content:
This font looks familiar. It's obviously modified and (unfortunately) cut off at the bottom. Any takers?   
   
 ![Grace](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201030923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24534.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Common videogame font - Reishotai (?) {Aleph Langley}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201030923/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2823 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Giornata Mondiale Alzheimer - Pendry Script {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201030923/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2888 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cybjorg

comments.content: If there is such a font as Delphian Solid, this is it. The letterforms match [Delphian Open](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201030923/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=205095), as far as I can tell.

Here is a better image. Hopefully it will help with identification.   
   
 ![a better image](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201030923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24675.jpg)
I agree with Mike, and probably the designer made it solid, he had to make changes anyway becouse of the R and A union. A little of work in the R and a little bit of Squoosh
I have the font, and I will see what I can do to replicate this. I'll post it when I'm done.

OK. Here is Grace replicated in Delphian Open, which I converted to outlines and either removed the white parts or moved the black parts together. I also manipulated the outline of the R to pull the tail down and outward a bit. I used a white square to block out the left leg of the A and it even created the same gap between the R and A. If "Squooshing" includes stretching, that's what was needed here (maybe you could do that as vertical "squooshing", but I actually widened the characters). If exactness was needed I would have played much longer, but I think I showed how this was probably done.   
 ![GraceDelphian](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201030923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24695.gif)

Laydeeez 'n' gennelmun, the fantorgastic, often imitated but   
never duplicated hardest working typeIDer of the moment   
_Miiiiike Ya-ne-ga!_ ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201030923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif) Look for IDs that carry the {Mike Y}   
quality seal, satisfaction guaranteed!
